articles.title: CyberKnife: Making prompt diagnosis and better treatment for brain tumor
articles.description: The treatment through CyberKnife is cost effective and it is almost similar to the cost of other surgeries
articles.content:
WORLD BRAIN TUMOR DAY
Brain tumors are very rare and cause swelling like tumors around the major veins of the brain and hence required delicate analysis of the situation. The occurrence of brain tumors in India is steadily rising. More and more cases... [5580 chars]

articles.title: Meet Craig Federighi, the brain behind Apple's macOS Tahoe 26 released at WWDC 2025
articles.description: Craig Federighi unveiled the macOS Tahoe 26 at Apple's Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) 2025 on Monday
articles.content: Craig Federighi unveiled the macOS Tahoe 26 at Apple's Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) 2025 on Monday. The transformative update to the Mac operating system comes with several features, including the use of a new material called Liquid Glass, ... [2137 chars]

articles.title: Justin Baldoni’s $400m defamation claim against Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds dismissed
articles.description: Judge finds Lively’s accusations of sexual harassment were legally protected and therefore immune from suit
articles.content:
A judge on Monday dismissed Justin Baldoni’s $400m defamation claim against Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds, after finding that Lively’s accusations of sexual harassment against Baldoni were legally protected and therefore immune from suit.
The entire... [2501 chars]

articles.description: It's time to see if we're getting iOS 26 or iOS 19.

articles.title: Mark English smashes Irish record to win 800m in the Netherlands in stunning fashion
articles.description: Mark English unleashed a spectacular performance to smash his own Irish 800m record and take victory at the FBK Games in Hengelo, the Netherlands on Monday evening, the 32-year-old becoming the first Irishman to run under 1:44 when clocking 1:43.92.
articles.content:
Mark English unleashed a spectacular performance to smash his own Irish 800m record and take victory at the FBK Games in Hengelo, the Netherlands on Monday evening, the 32-year-old becoming the first Irishman to run under 1:44 when clocking 1:43.92.

articles.title: Six infants born with congenital measles in Ontario from unvaccinated mothers
articles.description: Ontario's chief medical officer of health says six infants have been born with congenital measles since an outbreak began last fall.
articles.content:
Ontario’s chief medical officer of health says six infants have been born with congenital measles since an outbreak began last fall, adding they were infected in the womb through mothers who were not vaccinated.

articles.title: Ontario woman who faked pregnancies to defraud doulas sentenced to five years behind bars
articles.description: A Brantford, Ont. woman who admitted to faking pregnancies and defrauded numerous doulas will spend the rest of her original sentence in police custody, plus an additional three years for new crimes.
articles.content:

articles.title: Glastonbury sells ‘a few thousand less tickets’ to avoid overcrowding
articles.description: Festival organiser Emily Eavis says other changes include Shangri-La area ‘going full trees and green space’
articles.content:
Glastonbury festival is known for its huge crowds, but last year overcrowding at smaller stages led to areas being closed off to prevent crowd crushes and one act was even forced to halt their set.

articles.title: Baldoni $400m lawsuit against Blake Lively dismissed
articles.description: A US judge has dismissed actor Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation lawsuit against actress Blake Lively, who had accused Baldoni of sexually harassing her while filming the 2024 movie It Ends With Us.
articles.content:
